commitMessage:"Avoid inner class cycle detection for non-matching predicate

JUnit 5.6 introduced inner class cycle detection in
ReflectionSupport.findNestedClasses() (see #2039). Unfortunately
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the
cycle detection introduced a regression for test classes that contain
classes with inner class cycles when those inner classes do not match
the predicate supplied to findNestedClasses() (e.g.
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: an exception is thrown for any inner class\ncycled detected
column7:
even if the cycle would not adversely affect test
discovery or execution.

This commit fixes this regression by avoiding inner class cycle
detection for candidate classes that do match the predicate. For
example
column8:
within JUnit Jupiter inner class cycle detection is now only
performed for inner classes annotated with @Nested.

Fixes #2249
"

mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
it is now only used if not blank.

Fixes #2248.

API documentation was linked. This is fixed by using
the version of AssertJ as defined in the gradle.properties
file located in the root directory of the project.

Closes #2200
"

commitMessage:"Move versions to gradle.properties (#2236)

Changing a version no longer requires recompiling buildSrc and it
enables to specify dependency versions from the command line.

Resolves #2234.

Co-authored-by: Marc Philipp <mail@marcphilipp.de>"
commitMessage:"Publish build scans for reproducibility checks\n"

commitMessage:"Make JAR builds reproducible (#2217)

This change uses Gradle's reproducible archives feature to consistently
build the output JARs.

Additionally
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the build now supports `SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH` to allow
overriding of `buildTimeAndDate` as this introduces non-determinism
into the build.

Timestamps in special-case JARs are now rewritten to make them
reproducible using the same fixed-time constant as is being used when
`isPreserveFileTimestamps` is set to false.

Moreover
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: a GitHub Actions workflow is added that checks whether build\r\nis still reproducible on CI."

commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": when using PER_CLASS test instance lifecycle\nsemantics
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: TestInstancePreDestroyCallback extensions were invoked in\nthe order in which they were registered
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
which violates the general
"wrapping" principle for extensions invoked after a container or test.

This commit fixes this by invoking TestInstancePreDestroyCallback
extensions in reverse registration order when PER_CLASS test instance
lifecycle semantics have been configured.

Fixes #2209

order to support custom version ID formats such as `4.12.0`

commitMessage:"Fix stack overflow error in assertIterableEquals

Prior to this commit an iterable of iterables (here instances
of java.nio.file.Path) passed to method `assertIterableEquals`
in class `Assertions` of the JUnit Jupiter API yielded a
`StackOverflowError`.

This commit prevent the eternal while-loop by leveraging the
`equals()`-implementation of the non-null expected element.

Fixes #2157
"

commitMessage:"Detect cycles in inner class hierarchies\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
an invocation of
ReflectionSupport.findNestedClasses() could result in infinite
recursion if an inner class hierarchy formed a cycle via inheritance.

This commit addresses this by introducing cycle detection in
ReflectionUtils.findNestedClasses.

Consequently
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the detection of cycles in @Nested test class hierarchies
will cause the JUnit Jupiter test engine to halt with an exception
instead of infinitely recursing.

Closes: #2039
"

wish to process test instances _after_ they have been used in tests and
_before_ they are destroyed.

into the test instance

commitMessage:"Log at DEBUG level when JUnit 4 is on classpath but Hamcrest is not\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
JUnit Jupiter emitted an INFO level log message
to inform users when JUnit 4 is present on the classpath but Hamcrest
is not. This log message is useful if one intends to use JUnit 4
assumptions; however
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: since Java Util Logging (JUL) logs INFO messages\nto STD_ERR
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
these messages showed up as RED in many IDEs which gave the
impression of an error.

In order to improve usability for use cases when Hamcrest is
intentionally not on the classpath but JUnit 4 is
column7:
this commit updates
OpenTest4JAndJUnit4AwareThrowableCollector to consistently log only at
DEBUG level.

Closes #2098
"

lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
class or method).
This prevents users from specifying multiple system properties or
environment variables for which an element should be enabled or
disabled.

This commit introduces repeatable annotation support for
@EnabledIfEnvironmentVariable

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Introduce discovery listeners and abort on failures by default

The `Launcher` now propagates errors during test discovery by default
instead of only logging and thereby potentially hiding them. In order
to restore the old
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the
`junit.platform.discovery.listener.default` configuration parameter can
be set to `logging`.

To support the above feature consistently
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
a new
`EngineDiscoveryListener` interface was introduced. `TestEngine`
implementations should now notify the listener that can be accessed via
the `EngineDiscoveryRequest.getDiscoveryListener()` method about each
processed `DiscoverySelector`. Test engines that use
`EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver` do not have to make any changes.

In addition
column7:
clients of the `Launcher` such as build tools and IDEs can
add `LauncherDiscoveryListeners` to `LauncherDiscoveryRequests` which
will be notified about the above events and the start and finish of each
engine's test discovery.

Resolves #2052."

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\: commitMessage:"Change default @Order value to Integer.MAX_VALUE / 2\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": the default @Order value for non-annotated\n@RegisterExtension fields and test methods was Integer.MAX_VALUE.\nConsequently
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: one could not assign an explicit order \"after\" the\ndefault value
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
since one cannot assign an integer value greater than
Integer.MAX_VALUE. This effectively made it impossible to register an
extension after other extensions registered via @RegisterExtension
unless *all* such extension fields were assigned explicit order values
via @Order.

This commit addresses this issue by changing the default @Order value
to Integer.MAX_VALUE / 2.

For example
column7:
an extension can be registered via @RegisterExtension with
an order value such as @Order(Order.DEFAULT + 1)  for registration
immediately after non-annotated extension fields  or
@Order(Integer.Integer.MAX_VALUE)  to be registered in the last
possible order value bucket.

Closes #1924
"

commitMessage:"Support for enabling or disabling tests on a range of JREs

Prior to this commit users had to use `@EnabledOnJre`/`@DisabledOnJre`
annotations with explicit `JRE` constants to simulate a range selection of
Java feature numbers.

This commit introduces two new annotations
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
which support two parameters: `min` and `max`.
`min` defaults to `JRE.Java_8` and `max` defaults to `JRE.OTHER`. Those default
values allow declaring half open ranges.

Resolves #2016"

commitMessage:"Add timeout config parameter\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
there was no option to disable
configured timeouts globally. This commit introduces
such an option via `"junit.jupiter.execution.timeout.mode"`.

Valid values are:
- "enabled": default value that enables timeouts
- "disabled": disables timeouts
- "disabled_on_debug": disables timeouts while debugging

A VM runtime is considered "to be in debug mode" when
one of its input parameters starts with "-agentlib:jdwp".

Resolves #1959
"

commitMessage:"Improve handling of duplicate Descriptions (#2044)

Some runners don't memoize Description instances and even pass different
instances when invoking testStarted and testFinished. This makes it
particularly difficult when there are multiple equal Description
instances in a Runner.

Prior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
such cases were deemed unresolvable which lead to
multiple dynamic TestDescriptors with the same unique ID being reported
which is a violation of the contract of TestExecutionListener.

Now
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
we assume the testStarted/testSkipped event for a Description with
multiple equal Descriptions is referring to the first Description that
hasn't yet been started or skipped. The corresponding TestDescriptor is
then reported as started/skipped. When testFinished is called for such
a Description
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: we check whether the same thread has previously reported\r\nan equal Description as started. If so
column7:
we report the corresponding
TestDescriptor as finished.

Fixes #2021."

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\: commitMessage:"Make CDATA end marker handling safer (#2032)\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": we detected CDATA end markers and manually added\r\nstart markers after each before passing the complete String to\r\n`XMLStreamWriter.writeCData()`. While that works
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: it's technically\r\nwrong because one should only pass valid CDATA blocks to that method.\r\nInstead
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: we now split the String at end markers and call `writeCData()`\r\nmultiple times."

commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": we scanned the hierarchy of a test class for\r\nmethods once for every test method. This lead to quadratic runtime\r\nbehavior and was problematic for large test classes. Now
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the new
`TestSourceProvider` caches the methods of a class so that we only need
to filter that list once for every test method.

Resolves #1965."

commitMessage:"Fix discovery of inherited nested classes

The discovery algorithm introduced in 5.5 remembers already the
resolution of each discovery selector. Prior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": nested\nclasses were resolved by adding a ClassSelector for the nested class.\nIf that ClassSelector has been resolved before
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: discovery is assumed to\nbe finished. Similarly
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: when resolving MethodSelectors for methods\nwithin a nested test class that have been resolved before
column7:
discovery
will stop.

This commit introduces dedicated selectors for nested classes and their
methods which take into account the actual enclosing classes that will
be present at runtime. These selectors are package-private for now but
could be made publicly available in a future release.

Fixes #1954.
"

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:

The discovery algorithm introduced in 5.5 remembers already the
resolution of each discovery selector. Prior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": nested\nclasses were resolved by adding a ClassSelector for the nested class.\nIf that ClassSelector has been resolved before
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: discovery is assumed to\nbe finished. Similarly
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: when resolving MethodSelectors for methods\nwithin a nested test class that have been resolved before
column7:
discovery
will stop.

This commit introduces dedicated selectors for nested classes and their
methods which take into account the actual enclosing classes that will
be present at runtime. These selectors are package-private for now but
could be made publicly available in a future release.

Fixes #1954.
"

commitMessage:"Fix programmatic extension registration for nested classes\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
extensions registered programmatically using the
`RegisterExtension` annotation were added to the wrong extension
registry multiple times for nested classes and their descendants.
Instead of storing them in the registry on the same level as the test
instance
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
they were always stored in the registry of the enclosing
class.

`TestInstancesProvider` now takes two arguments: An unmodifiable
`ExtensionRegistry` that is used to instantiate and initialize the test
instance and an extension registrar that is used to register additional
extensions that are registered programmatically. Except for nested
classes these are always the same. For nested classes
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: we need to\nensure that extensions registered on their level and below are not used\nto initialize enclosing classes. Thus
column7:
the parent's registry is used
for initialization but additional extensions from fields of the class
are registered with the current registry (usually the registry of the
test method

commitMessage:"Improve diagnostics for private @RegisterExtension fields\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": if a @RegisterExtension field was declared as\nprivate
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: JUnit Jupiter silently ignored it. Consequently
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
it was
difficult for a user to determine why the extension "was not working".

corresponding test method or test class if a @RegisterExtension field
is private.

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\: commitMessage:"Make test less flaky on Windows\n"
commitMessage:"Polishing\n"
commitMessage:"Relax @RegisterExtension field type restriction\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the declared field type for an extension
registered via @RegisterExtension was required to implement an
extension API (or at least the Extension marker interface). This put an
unnecessary burden on the extension developer and simultaneously
exposed JUnit Jupiter extension APIs to users of the extension. This
restriction effectively does not allow for proper separation of concerns
or encapsulation.

This commit addresses this issue by moving the "instance of Extension"
check to field evaluation time. Consequently
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
a @RegisterExtension
field may now be declared as any type implemented by the evaluated
field value.

Closes #1908
"

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Introduce declarative timeouts

This commit introduces declarative timeouts for testable and lifecycle
methods. The API surface consists of a new `@Timeout` annotation that
can be applied to `@Test`
column7: it can be applied to a test class which\r\nhas the same meaning as declaring it on all of its testable
column9: default timeouts can be defined using configuration parameters\r\nfor all of the above methods
column12: or each method type individually.\r\n\r\nThe timeout is implemented in a preemptive manner
column13: but without having to\r\nexecute the test in a different thread. Instead
column14: a single-thread\r\n`ExecutorService` is used to schedule an interrupt of the original test\r\nthread. This way
column15:
`ThreadLocal` will continue to work which is important
for integration tests that use frameworks like Spring and its
`@Transactional` support.

Resolves #80."

commitMessage:"Make junit:junit an api dependency of junit-vintage-engine

For consistency with how Maven resolves `junit-jupiter` and because
`junit-vintage-engine` cannot function without `junit:junit` it is now
an `api` dependency which maps to Maven's `compile` scope in the
published POM.

Resolves #1872.
"

commitMessage:"Deprecate "Script-based Conditions" for removal

Script-based condition APIs and their supporting implementations are
deprecated with the intent to remove them in JUnit Jupiter 5.6.

Users should instead rely on a combination of other built-in conditions
or create and use a custom implementation of `ExecutionCondition` to
evaluate the same conditions.

Closes #1882
"

A custom class loader is created for additional class path entries
supplied by the user when starting the console launcher with its
"--class-path" option.
Prior to this commit that class loader was used by but never closed
after its usage. Now every class loader implementing the AutoCloseable
interface is closed.

Closes #1896

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\: commitMessage:"Introduce explicit Java modules\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
JUnit 5 provided stable Java module names
via Automatic-Module-Name entries in its artifact's MANIFEST.MF
files. Those entries are deleted by this commit and replaced by
explicit Java modules.

## Modules

This commit introduces module descriptors for each published
artifact. They can be found in:

  ${project.name}/src/module/${module.name}/module-info.java

The directives used within the module descriptors "mirror" the
configuration of JUnit 5's Gradle build setup.


## Multi-release JAR "junit-platform-commons"

This commit also removes the junit-platform-commons-java-9 project.
It is replaced by a Gradle `mainRelease9` source set in the default
junit-platform-commons project. This source set now contains the
versioned `ModuleUtils` utility class.


## Cleanup

All integration tests affected by this change are adopted to the
new modular constraints. Also
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
an internal ClasspathScanningSupport
class was removed by this commit: remaining code is moved to
`EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver` as a private method and the package
`org.junit.platform.engine.support.filter` was pruned.


Closes #1091"

column9: for example a Spock\nspecification with a regular and an unrolled feature method. Instead

is started for which the container is not an ancestor.

commitMessage:"Fix Android support

`java.util.regex.Pattern.UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS` isn't supported on
all runtime platforms
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
like Android. This commit guards the compilation
of the regex pattern by catching `IllegalArgumentException` -- and
falling back to match only ASCII control characters.

Note: according to https://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/regex/Pattern.html#UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS
the Unicode mode is always enabled on Android. Thus all of the
characters that Unicode refers to as 'control characters' are still
matched on Android.

Fixes #1800
"

commitMessage:"Fix Specification-Version entry in JAR manifest files

Since the conversion from Groovy to Kotlin the regular expression used
to determine the Specification-Version value produced something like:

  Specification-Version: MatchGroup(value=5.4.0
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
range=0..4)

This commit fixes it by accessing the value of the match group. Also
an integration test is added that verifies this and other manifest
entries.

Closes #1766
"

commitMessage:"Fix Android support

`java.util.regex.Pattern.UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS` isn't supported on
all runtime platforms
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
like Android. This commit guards the compilation
of the regex pattern by catching `IllegalArgumentException` -- and
falling back to match only ASCII control characters.

Note: according to https://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/regex/Pattern.html#UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS
the Unicode mode is always enabled on Android. Thus all of the
characters that Unicode refers to as 'control characters' are still
matched on Android.

Fixes #1800
"

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Introduce configurable discovery algorithm

The `EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver` class implements a test discovery
in a way that can be reused by different test engines. The Jupiter and
Vintage test engines are changed to use it.

Main entry point is `EngineDiscoveryRequestResolver.builder()` which
allows to add resolvers (via a new `SelectorResolvers` interface) and
visitors (reusing `TestDescriptor.Visitor`) that will be called to
resolve `DiscoverySelectors` in a given `EngineDiscoveryRequest`.

In order to support class based test engines
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": the predefined\n`ClassContainerSelectorResolver` may be added via the builder as well.\nIt resolves `ClasspathRootSelectors`
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
and
`PackageSelectors` into `ClassSelectors` by scanning for classes in the
corresponding class container.

The fundamental principle behind `SelectorResolver` is that both the
designated parent of a `TestDescriptor` and its designated children can
be specified using `DiscoverySelectors`. For example
column7: in the case of the\nJupiter engine
column8: when resolving a nested test class
column9:
there's a resolver
that specifies the parent using the `ClassSelector` of the enclosing
class and the children as the set of `MethodSelectors` of the testable
methods it contains joined with the set of `ClassSelectors` of nested
classes it contains.

Overall
column10:
the algorithm works as follows:

1. Enqueue all selectors in the supplied request to be resolved.
2. While there are selectors to be resolved
column12:
the resolution is finished.
   a. Iterate over all registered `SelectorResolvers` in the order they
      were registered in and find the first one that returns a non-empty
      resolution.
   b. If such a resolution exists
column13: enqueue the contained selectors.\n   c. For each exact match in the resolution
column14:
expand its children and
      enqueue them as well.
   d. Iterate over all registered visitors and let the engine descriptor
      accept them.

Descriptors with the same unique ID are only resolved once

commitMessage:"Use default toString() when reporting competing ParameterResolvers\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": if multiple competing ParameterResolvers of the\nexact same type were encountered
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:

occurrences of the same fully qualified class name which did not
provide any information about the instances.

default toString() output for each ParameterResolver. This ensures that
the type and hash code are reported for each resolver even if the
resolver implementation overrides toString().

commitMessage:"Fix test coverage for :junit-jupiter-params

Prior to this commit the coverage for `junit-jupiter-params` was missing
from the aggregated JaCoCo report because the tests were executed using
different class files than those used by downstream projects that use
`@ParameterizedTests`. The classes are different because we relocate
classes using the shadow plugin which modifies the bytecode. The code
in the buildscript that attempted to replace the classes directory with
the shadowed jar file for the project's `test` task was broken since the
migration to Kotlin DSL in 82eb832.

Note to self: `classpath.minus(files)` does not modify `classpath` but
returns a new one.

`TestPlan` returned from `Launcher.discover()` instead of the one passed
to `TestExecutionListener.testPlanExecutionStarted()`. Ignoring calls
caused tests with dynamic parents

we now warn once per `TestPlan` and
include a link to our issue tracker.

commitMessage:"Avoid NullPointerException when creating Executions from filtered events\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the logic in Executions.createExecutions() could
result in a NullPointerException if the executions were being created
from filtered events.

For example
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
an attempt to create executions from
`testEvents.failed().executions()` resulted in a NullPointerException
since the "started" event (needed to determine the start Instant) was
no longer present in the event list.

This commit fixes this bug by avoiding the creation of Execution
instances if the "started" event is absent.

Consequently
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
an invocation such as
`testEvents.failed().executions().count()` now returns `0` instead of
throwing a NullPointerException.

Issue: #1356
"

commitMessage:"Prevent thread interrupt from causing subsequent test failures\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": if a container or test that was executed via a\nHierarchicalTestExecutorService (e.g.
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: a @Test method in JUnit Jupiter)\ninterrupted the current thread (e.g.
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: via\nThread.currentThread().interrupt()) but failed to clear the\n'interrupted status' flag for the current thread
column7:
that particular
container or test may have passed but inadvertently caused subsequent
containers or tests to fail if the latter attempted to interact with
the thread in any manner that might result in an InterruptedException.

This commit fixes this issue by clearing the 'interrupted status' flag
for the current thread after each container or test executed via
HierarchicalTestExecutorService.

In addition

commitMessage:"Introduce runtime dependency from Jupiter API to its Engine

Prior to this commit users needed to declare a runtime dependency for
the Jupiter Engine despite a compile time dependency to the Jupiter API
was already in place:
```
  testCompile('org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-api:<version>')
  testRuntime('org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-engine:<version>')
```
This commit introduces the runtime dependency to `junit-jupiter-engine`
per default. This allows users to omit the explicit declaration of the
runtime dependency:
```
  testCompile('org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-api:<version>')
```

This also works for Maven-based dependency resolution build tools.

Addresses issue #1669

'~/.gradle/gradle.properties' file. The platform-tooling-support project
will pass them the test environment for consumption.

method to provide a stream of multidimensional arrays to a

commitMessage:"Introduce Try type to preserve failure cause

Exceptions reported due to failed reflective operations such as loading
a class
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
or looking up a method by name now
include the original exception as their cause to make it easier to debug
underlying issues.

Such operations in `ReflectionUtils` and `ReflectionSupport` no longer
return an instance of `Optional` but one of a new `Try` type which
encapsulates either a successful invocation with a (nullable) resulting
value or a failure with an exception as its cause. Depending on the
caller
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
the cause can then be logged or rethrown as appropriate.

Resolves #602.
"

commitMessage:"Ensure Random ordering with custom seed works with parallel execution

This commit introduces a new constraint on the order in which the
orderMethods() and getDefaultExecutionMode() methods in a MethodOrderer
are invoked.

Specifically
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
orderMethods() is now guaranteed to be invoked before
getDefaultExecutionMode() so that the latter may include logic that
determines the appropriate return value based on what was performed in
orderMethods().

This commit also fixes a bug in the Random MethodOrderer when a custom
seed is configured and tests are executed in parallel. Specifically
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the getDefaultExecutionMode() in the Random orderer now returns
SAME_THREAD if a custom seed has been configured and otherwise
CONCURRENT.

Issue: #13

commitMessage:"Convert Test Kit to a fluent API

This commit includes a major overhaul of the existing Test Kit API in
order to shift to a fluent API for all parts of the Test Kit except
ExecutionEventConditions and TestExecutionResultConditions.

The key abstractions that enable the fluent API include the Events
faade
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
and the Executions faade.

Consult the changes to DisabledTests and IgnoreConditionTests to see
examples of some of the major improvements over the previous API.

Documentation of the Test Kit in the Release Notes and User Guide will
be addressed in #1621.

Issue: #1662
"

commitMessage:"Include stack trace of all exceptions in Assertions.assertAll()\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": exceptions tracked by Assertions.assertAll() were\nproperly reported via a MultipleFailuresError; however
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the stack
traces for individual exceptions were not retained.

This commit addresses this issue by storing all such exceptions as
suppressed exceptions within the resulting MultipleFailuresError.
Consequently
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
the stack traces for such exceptions are now visible as
"Suppressed" at the end of the stack trace for the invocation of
assertAll().

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\: commitMessage:"Polish Release Notes\n"

commitMessage:"Set context class loader parallel execution mode (#1647)

Prior to this commit the `ForkJoinPoolHierarchicalTestExecutorService`
used the default `ForkJoinWorkerThreadFactory` which in turn sets the
context class loader to `ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader()`.
In runtime environments that create and use a tailored context
class loader this leads to `ClassNotFoundException` when only the
`ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader()` is available.

Now the `ForkJoinPoolHierarchicalTestExecutorService` creates
`ForkJoinWorkerThread` instances that set the context class loader
to the one available at creation time of the service.

Fixes #1646

Co-Authored-By: @marcphilipp"

commitMessage:"Support converting integral types in hex and octal

types. This allows the values to be specified in the following format:

        Signopt # HexDigits
        Signopt 0 OctalDigits
    Sign:
        -
        +

Resolves #1624."

commitMessage:"Remove reference cycles from 'junit-jupiter-engine'

Remove reference cycles from 'junit-jupiter-engine' by declaring

instances of
AssumptionViolatedException thrown during test execution will now cause
a test to abort instead of fail.

commitMessage:"Remove variants of assertThrows accepting ThrowingSupplier

JUnit Jupiter 5.3.0 introduced new variants of `assertThrows()` that
accept `ThrowingSupplier` arguments instead of `Executable` (see #1394).
However
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": this change prevents existing code from compiling against\nJupiter 5.3.0 if the code in question used a method reference for an\noverloaded method with a `void` return type. Consequently
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
this was a
breaking change.

Note that overloaded methods with non-void return types are not
affected. For example
column7:
it still can be used as a method reference as
`future::get` without suffering from issues with type inference since
such a method can always properly be inferred to be a
`ThrowingSupplier`.

This commit fixes the breaking change by removing all variants of
`assertThrows` that accept a `ThrowingSupplier`. In addition
column8: this\ncommit reverts the related changes to `ThrowingSupplier` (i.e.
column9:
it no
longer implements `Executable` via a `default` interface method).

Issue: #1576
"

expected description lines.

commitMessage:"Further reduce memory footprint of parallel execution\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the complete `TestDescriptor` tree of a
`TestEngine` that extends `HierarchicalTestEngine` (such as the Jupiter
engine) was wrapped in `NodeTestTask` instances prior to its execution.
This was done in order to store the `ResourceLock` and the forced
`ExecutionMode` as determined by the `NodeTestTaskWalker` class (in
order to ensure deadlock-free execution).

Now
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: the (renamed) `NodeTreeWalker` returns a `NodeExecutionAdvisor`\nwhich stores this information and provides it to `NodeTestTask`\ninstances. Thus
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
`NodeTestTask` instances are created on the fly instead
of up front.

In addition
column7: the new `NodeTestTaskContext` class provides access to\n`EngineExecutionListener`
column10: and `NodeExecutionAdvisor` which are\nidentical for all `NodeTestTasks`. Previously
column11:
each `NodeTestTask`
had separate references to the first three of these.

Resolves #1578.
"

commitMessage:"Fix OutOfMemoryError regression in JUnit 5.3.0

JUnit 5.3.0 introduced support for parallel test execution that
included a new NodeTestTask class that is used internally by
HierarchicalTestEngine implementations such as the Jupiter and Vintage
test engines.

Prior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": each NodeTestTask permanently held references to\ncontext state for itself and its parent node. In the case of the JUnit\nJupiter test engine
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: this context state held a reference to the test\nclass instance. Consequently
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: if test class instances across a test\nsuite collectively allocated large amounts of memory
column7:
an
OutOfMemoryError would result due to insufficient heap space.

This commit fixes the core issue by clearing references to the parent
and local contexts in NodeTestTask after they are no longer needed
column8:
allowing them to be properly garbage collected by the JVM.

Issue: #1578
"

commitMessage:"Disallow TestInstanceFactory overrides in @Nested test classes

JUnit 5.3 RC1 introduced a TestInstanceFactory extension API with
support for overriding a TestInstanceFactory registered on an enclosing
class for an enclosed @Nested class. However
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": similar \"overriding\"\nsupport does not exist for traditional test class hierarchies (i.e.
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
a
subclass cannot override a TestInstanceFactory registered on a
superclass).

This commit aligns the behavior between conventional class inheritance
hierarchies and nested class hierarchies by disallowing
TestInstanceFactory overrides in @Nested test classes.

Issues: #672

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Emit warning when TestEngine ID starts with "junit-"

The junit- prefix is owned by the JUnit Team. It's akin to using
"org.junit" as a base package. No other entity in the world should do
that. Only two engines should use the prefix at the moment:

 - junit-jupiter
 - junit-vintage

This commit enforces these rules.

Closes #1557

commitMessage:"Document registering extensions via static fields in Kotlin

JUnit Jupiter extensions can be registered programmatically using
`@RegisterExtension`. When one wants to register extensions that
implement class-level extension APIs
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
they have to be registered as
static fields.

In the Kotlin programming language this is normally achieved using the
`@JvmStatic` annotation.  However
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: that will not work because a private\r\nfield will be generated
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
and private fields are filtered out by JUnit
Jupiter. The correct approach is to use `@JvmField` instead.

This commit documents the correct approach and provides a Kotlin example
analogous to the existing Java one.

Resolves #1500."

commitMessage:"Improve error message for test instance created via different ClassLoader

This commit improves the error message for a TestInstanceFactory that
instantiates the test class using a different ClassLoader than the one
used by the JupiterTestEngine. This is achieved by appending an "@"
symbol and the system identity hash code to each fully qualified test
class name.

This change helps users to disambiguate between such classes whose
fully qualified names would otherwise appear to be identical.

commitMessage:"Increase parallelism of dynamic test execution

This commit increases the amount of allowed queued work for the worker
thread to the desired level of parallelism. This optimistically assumes
that the already queued tasks can be stolen by other workers and the new
task requires about the same execution time as the already queued tasks.
If the other workers are busy
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": the parallelism is already at its desired\nlevel. If all already queued tasks can be stolen by otherwise idle\nworkers and the new task takes significantly longer
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
that only happens if the enclosing test task is the only
one remaining which should rarely be the case.

Issue: #1491
"

commitMessage:"Use correct class for method-based test descriptors\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
`MethodBasedTestDescriptor` and
`VintageTestDescriptor` did not preserve the original test class of the
discovered method and instead obtained it from the
`java.lang.reflect.Method`. This was problematic for inherited test
methods
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: since they appeared to come from the declaring class instead of\r\nthe current test class. In addition
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: the Maven Surefire provider failed\r\nto match such methods when executing tests matching a mask (e.g.
column7:
via
`-Dtest=*MaskTest`).

This commit fixes this problem by modifying `MethodBasedTestDescriptor`
and `VintageTestDescriptor` to ensure that the underlying
`MethodSource` preserves the correct

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\: commitMessage:"Handle exceptions in StringUtils.nullSafeToString()\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": if the toString() implementation of an object\nsupplied to nullSafeToString() threw an exception
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: that exception would\nsimply be allowed to propagate. Consequently
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
unexpected failures could
occur simply because the framework was attempting to safely generate a
String representation of a given object.

This commit improves the "safety" of nullSafeToString() by catching any
exception encountered while attempting to safely generate a String
representation. If an exception is caught in the process
column7: \nnullSafeToString() will now generate a default String representation\nbased on the object's fully qualified class name and system hash code
column8:
separated by an "@" symbol.

This change affects the following use cases.

- The generation of detailed failure messages for failed assertions no
  longer fails if the toString() implementation of an object supplied to
  the assertion throws an exception.
- Display name generation for a @ParameterizedTest no longer fails if
  the toString() implementation of an argument for the parameterized
  test throws an exception.
- The use of ToStringBuilder for building strings is now safer.

commitMessage:"Limit queue size of dynamic tests\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
concurrently executed dynamic tests (e.g. from a
Jupiter `@ParameterizedTest`) were forked immediately after being
reported even though all worker threads of the `ForkJoinPool` were
already busy. Now
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: we limit the amount of queued work by using\n`ForkJoinTask.getSurplusQueuedTaskCount()`. We only fork execution if
column7: the task can be executed right away.\nOtherwise
column8:
we execute the task in the current thread which effectively
blocks further dynamic tests from being reported and queued.

commitMessage:"Make ThrowableCollector configurable

This commit generalizes `ThrowableCollector` to take a predicate that
is used to decide whether a `Throwable` is aborted or failed execution.
The Jupiter engines uses a specialized implementation that treats OTA's
`TestAbortedExceptions` as aborting and everything else as failing:
`OpenTest4JAwareThrowableCollector`.

In addition
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
this commit introduces `ThrowableCollector.Factory` and
lets `HierarchicalTestEngines` create them in order to allow the engine
to decide how to configure its `ThrowableCollectors`. For backwards
compatibility
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the default implementation returns a factory that
always creates instances of `OpenTest4JAwareThrowableCollector`.

commitMessage:"Polishing\n"

commitMessage:"Instantiate converters and aggregators only once per parameterized test

Prior to this commit `ArgumentConverter` and `ArgumentsAggregator`
classes were instantiated once per invocation of the
`@ParameterizedTest`.

With this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": instances will be created during the first invocation\nof the `@ParameterizedTest` method
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
stored and reused on subsequent
invocations.

If the same converter of aggregator classes are used on other
`@ParameterizedTest` methods a new instance will be created on first
invocation and reused for subsequent invocations of that method.

Of the two proposed options to implement this
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
either eager
instantiation or reuse I chose reuse. The rationale was if the
instantiation of a Converter of Aggregator failed with an exception this
error could be caught with the existing safe mechanism and also for the
failure to be very close to the impacting test invocation.

Issue: #1397

commitMessage:"Introduce support for parallel test execution

This commit adds opt-in support for parallel test execution and
capturing output to `System.out` and `System.err`. Both features are
disabled by default but can be enabled and configured using
configuration parameters.

The implementation is based on the Fork/Join Framework and designed to
be reusable by other test engines that extend HierarchicalTestEngine.

The Jupiter API provides annotations to declare which shared resources a
test needs to access and in which way. Moreover
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the execution mode of a
test can be influenced.

In addition
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
a number of TestExecutionListeners have been made
thread-safe.

The documentation subproject is now configured to execute tests in
parallel. All other subprojects will have to wait as Gradle currently
blows up when used with parallel test execution.

Resolves #60. Closes #1461.

Co-authored-by: Leonard Brnings <lord_damokles@gmx.net>
Co-authored-by: Christian Stein <sormuras@gmail.com>
"

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Remove annotation cache from AnnotationUtils

Since the annotation cache in AnnotationUtils has not been proven to
actually benefit third-party extensions or TestEngine implementations
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the JUnit Team has decided to completely remove the annotation cache
from AnnotationUtils.

Consequently
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: annotations looked up via the findAnnotation() methods in\nAnnotationSupport also no longer cache the results
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
since
AnnotationSupport simply delegates to AnnotationUtils.

If the team later becomes aware of concrete use cases that would
significantly benefit extension and test engine authors
column7: this feature\nmay potentially be reintroduced with a bounded cache and an LRU eviction\npolicy. In the interim
column8:
extension and test engine authors may implement
custom caching to meet their own needs.

Issue: #1459
"

commitMessage:"Use same JDK as current tests do

Prior to this commit the environment variable JAVA_HOME was passed
untouched to the external tool execution environment. As that
variable might point a different JDK/JRE installation than the
current one executing the tests it could lead to unexpected test
results.

Now
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": the path for JAVA_HOME is extracted from current process by\ndefault. If an tests needs a dedicated JDK/JRE installation
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: it\nis free to pass it via its environment map.\n"

to a dynamic container or test by adding static factory methods that
take a test source uri as a parameter.

`MethodSource` pointing to the `@TestFactory` annotated method.

commitMessage:"Invoke AfterAllCallback only if BeforeAllCallback invoked\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": an AfterAllCallback would always be invoked when\nusing @TestInstance(Lifecycle.PER_CLASS)
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
even if an exception was
thrown by the test class constructor. This is inappropriate since
implementations of BeforeAllCallback would not be invoked in such
cases
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
and as a general rule JUnit never invokes AfterX methods or
callbacks if the corresponding BeforeX methods or callbacks were not
invoked.

This commit fixes this issue by ensuring that AfterAllCallbacks are
only invoked if BeforeAllCallbacks were invoked.

Fixes: #1460

commitMessage:"Ensure discovered descriptor graphs are acyclic

Prior this commit only a null-check was performed by the DefaultLauncher
against the root test descriptor returned by an engine. Other properties
where not checked
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
especially if the graph of that root descriptor
contained cycles it could lead to stack overflow errors when traversing
the graph for execution.

This commit addresses this issue by explicitly checking the returned
graph of the root test descriptor for cycles. If a cycle is detected a
PreconditionViolationException is thrown.

Fixes: #1447
"

commitMessage:"Ensure type inference for assertThrows works properly

Issue #1394 improved the assertThrows() failure message if a lambda
expression or method reference returns a result instead of throwing an
exception. To achieve this
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": it introduced new variants of\nassertThrows() that accept a ThrowingSupplier instead of an Executable.\nHowever
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
that unfortunately causes the Java compiler to be unable to
disambiguate between the ThrowingSupplier and Executable variants when
performing type inference in certain scenarios. The result is that
certain code which previously compiled no longer compiles.

This commit fixes this issue by having ThrowingSupplier extend
Executable with a default implementation of Executable's execute()
method that delegates to ThrowingSupplier's get() method and simply
ignores the return value. When affected code is recompiled against the
new APIs
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: the inferred type will now be a ThrowingSupplier instead of\nan Executable; however
column7: the runtime semantics of the assertions remain\nunchanged. In addition
column8:
previously compiled code should be unaffected
by these changes since the Executable variants remain intact.

Fixes: #1414
"

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\: commitMessage:"Introduce future::get test for assertThrows()\n\nIssues: #1394
commitMessage:"Ensure assertThrows() is tested against Executable and ThrowingSupplier\n\nIssues: #1394
commitMessage:"Improve error messages for ParameterResolutionExceptions\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
error messages for ParameterResolutionExceptions
generically referred to a constructor or a method as an "executable".

Although that is technically correct
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: many developers are not familiar\nwith the fact that Constructor and Method share Executable as a common\nsuperclass. Consequently
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
the term "executable" is somewhat cryptic for
most developers.

This commit addresses this issue by explicitly stating that the
Executable is either a "constructor" or a "method" when generating
error messages for ParameterResolutionExceptions.

Issue: #1448
"

commitMessage:"Polish grammar\n"
commitMessage:"Make Jupiter discovery mechanism more robust\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": the entire test plan for JUnit Jupiter would halt\nprematurely whenever certain types of errors occurred during the\ndiscovery phase. Consequently
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: an exception\nthrown by a registered DiscoverySelector
column7:
etc.) would result in zero
tests being discovered and executed for the entire Jupiter test engine.

This commit addresses this issue by catching and logging discovery
errors within the JupiterTestEngine instead of aborting the entire test
plan prematurely. This enables JUnit Jupiter to discover and execute as
many tests as possible while still informing the user of containers and
tests that could not be properly discovered.

Issue: #1438
"

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\: commitMessage:"Ignore nested type with invalid class file\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
an attempt to find nested test classes using
ReflectionUtils.findNestedClasses() resulted in a NoClassDefFoundError
if a nested class or nested interface had an invalid class file (which
could happen due to a bug in a compiler such as one reported for the
Groovy compiler).

This commit addresses this issue by catching a NoClassDefFoundError
thrown by an invocation of Class#getDeclaredClasses() and logging it
instead of allowing it to propagate. Such nested classes and their
siblings are now effectively ignored.

Issue: #1436
"

commitMessage:"Enforce parameter order for @ParameterizedTest with aggregators

This commit introduces a best-effort approach to enforcing the
following policy for parameterized test methods that accept aggregators
as arguments.

- zero or more indexed arguments come first.
- zero or more aggregators come next.
- zero or more arguments supplied by other ParameterResolver
  implementations come last.

Issue: #1191

commitMessage:"Support widening primitive conversion for method invocations

This commit introduces support in ReflectionUtils.isAssignableTo() for
determining if Java supports a "widening primitive conversion" from the
source object to the target type.

In addition
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the DefaultArgumentConverter for implicit argument
conversion in parameterized tests has also been modified to use
ReflectionUtils.isAssignableTo() instead of performing a simple
"instance of" check against the target type. Consequently
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
primitive
arguments (or their corresponding wrappers) may now be supplied to a
@ParameterizedTest with automatic widening conversion.

Issue: #1092
"

commitMessage:"Introduce @Nested test with annotated constructor parameter

This commit introduces a @Nested test to verify support for constructor
injection via a ParameterResolver that looks up an annotation on the
Parameter supplied via the ParameterContext.

The test is @DisabledOnJre(JAVA_8) due to a bug in javac that was first
fixed in JDK 9. Note
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
that the test executes and passes on both
JDK 9 and JDK 10.

Issue: #1345
"

commitMessage:"Treat `ALL-DEFAULT` runtime modules as root modules.

JUnit Jupiter Engine now "requires java.scripting" which is not resolved
by default -- at least on OpenJDK 10.

Details at http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/jigsaw-dev/2018-February/thread.html#13574

commitMessage:"Discover children of ignored Vintage test classes\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": the Vintage test engine only returned a childless\nTestDescriptor for test classes annotated with @Ignore. However
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: build\ntools like Gradle need to show an accurate number of tests
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
i.e. they
want to access the test methods of an ignored test class.

The Jupiter engine already discovers skipped containers
column8:
including their children and
descendants. The Vintage engine now adopts this approach and returns
a full subtree of TestDescriptors for classes annotated with @Ignore.
During execution
column9:
it will only report the TestDescriptor of the test
class as skipped which is consistent with how the Jupiter engine
reports skipped containers.

Fixes #1277.
"

commitMessage:"Introduce ScriptEvaluationException

Prior to this commit a generic JUnitException was thrown when an error
occurred while evaluating condition scripts. Now an instance of the
specialized ScriptEvaluationException is thrown signalling the context
of the error.

This commit also treats `null` results returned from scripts as an
error: `null` can't be converted to an unambiguous instance of
ConditionEvaluationResult.

commitMessage:"Ensure JUnit Jupiter test classes cannot be private\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": if a test class was discovered via package
column7: it could NOT be private; however
column8: if the\nsame test class was selected explicitly (i.e.
column9: via one of the\n`selectClass()` variants in `DiscoverySelectors`
column10: via the `aClass` or\n`classes` element of the `selectors` configuration for the\n`junitPlatform` Gradle plugin
column11:
or via the `-select-class` or `-c`
command-line options for the `ConsoleLauncher`) it COULD then be
private.

This behavior is inconsistent and dangerous: although a developer could
execute such a test class in an IDE
column12:
the same test classes would never
be executed with a typical build configuration that relies on class
path or module path scanning.

This commit ensures that JUnit Jupiter test classes can never be
private
column13: regardless of how they are discovered or selected.\n\nIn addition
column14:
this commit removes the now obsolete IsScannableTestClass
predicate since scanned test classes are no longer handled differently.

Fixes: #1252
"

use of the JPMS module-path. The flag is now replaced by an empty file
collection that can filled with module-path entries at configuration

arguments are added to the JavaExec task

unless already specified:

java
  --module-path <modulepath>
  --add-modules ALL-MODULE-PATH
--module
  org.junit.platform.console
  --scan-modules

Examples usage from a 'build.gradle':

junitPlatform {
	modulepath = files(configurations.testRuntimeClasspath

commitMessage:"Surefire support for running set of methods

This commit makes surefire provider able to recognize '-Dtest=...'
system property and filter discovered/executed tests based on
it's value.

Surefire parses provided system property value into `TestListResolver`
which represents included and excluded tests as an object model. Model
can be queried if particular class & method pair is included or not
using `#shouldRun(String
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": String)` method. This commit wraps\n`TestListResolver` into a `PostDiscoveryFilter`
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: which is used to\ndiscover and execute actual tests with the `Launcher`.\n"

commitMessage:"Always set junitPlatformTest task dependencies

Prior to this commit the `junitPlatformTest` task (extending `JavaExec`)
used its `classpath` parameter to find tasks which create the needed
JARs and marks these tasks as dependencies during the task graph
generation phase. "Module-path mode" clears this parameter so
`dependsOn` becomes the only source of dependencies and the task gets
executed too early.

Now the dependencies are always set via `dependsOn`:

  junitTask.dependsOn.add(project.sourceSets.test.runtimeClasspath)
  junitTask.dependsOn.add(project.configurations.junitPlatform)

Addresses #1233
"

containing the console application.

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Use factory method/constructor as fallback for implicit arg conversion

This commit introduces a new ArgumentConverter that uses a static
factory method or factory constructor as a fallback for implicit
argument conversion from a String to an <object> for an argument in a
@ParameterizedTest
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
where <object> is the concrete target type for the
argument being converted.

The search algorithm for finding such a factory method or constructor
is as follows.

- Search for a single static factory method in the target type that
  converts from a String to the target type.
  - Use the factory method if present.
  - If multiple such factory methods are discovered they will be
    ignored.
- Search for a single constructor in the target type that accepts a
  String.
  - Use the constructor if present.
- If neither a single factory method nor a single constructor is found
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the converter will act as a no-op.

Note that private factory methods and constructors will be ignored.

Issue: #1231
"

commitMessage:"Introduce ExtensionContext.Store.CloseableResource interface

An extension context store is bound to its extension context lifecycle.
When an extension context lifecycle ends it closes its associated store.
All stored values that are instances of
{@link ExtensionContext.Store.CloseableResource} are notified by
invoking their {@code close()} method.

Closes #742

commitMessage:"Rename console option from --scan-module-path to --scan-modules

The old option name could falsely be interpreted as if the console
launcher did parse each module-path entry for test discovery. The
new console launcher option --scan-modules drops the "path" token
in order to not mislead users.

The implementation did not change: all resolved Java modules available
on the boot layer configuration are scanned for test discovery.

commitMessage:"Generate default failure messages for assertTrue() & assertFalse()\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
assertTrue() and assertFalse() in the JUnit
Jupiter Assertions class did not generate default failure messages.

This commit improves the usability of such failure scenarios by
generating meaningful default failure messages for assertTrue()
and assertFalse().

Failure messages for assertTrue() and assertFalse() are now aligned
with failure messages for assertEquals.

For example
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the generated failure message for a call to
`assertTrue(false)` is now "expected: <true> but was: <false>" instead
of an empty string.

Similarly
column7:
"custom")` now results
in a failure message of "custom ==> expected: <true> but was: <false>".

The failure message generation for assertFalse() is analogous to the
new behavior for assertTrue().

Issue: #1095
"

commitMessage:"Introduce internal predicate wrapper named ClassFilter

Prior to this commit many methods in classes and interfaces of package
`org.junit.platform.commons.util` were using the two parameters
classNameFilter and classTester in their signatures their like:

commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
Predicate<String> classNameFilter

will reduce many method signature parts down to

and provides a future-proof way of extending the class filter
implementation without changing the method signatures again.

commitMessage:"Make custom logging faade testable

This commit introduces a LogRecordListener that can be registered with
JUnit's logging faade for JUL via the LoggerFactory. Such a listener
can be queried for all log records that were submitted since the
listener was registered. This makes it possible for tests to register
a listener for a given scenario that is supposed to log something and
then verify that the expected message got logged at the expected level.

After such a test scenario has completed
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the test code should remove
the listener from the LoggerFactory.

To simplify matters
column7:
and removal of a listener are all encapsulated in a JUnit
Jupiter extension that is registered via a new @TrackLogRecords in the
junit-jupiter-engine test source tree.

See MultipleTestableAnnotationsTests for an example of this
functionality in action.

Issue: #1047
"

commitMessage:"Use propdeps plugin to configure @API Guardian as optional dependency

This commit introduces use of the propdeps-plugin from the Spring Team
so that we can flag dependencies on the apiguardian-api artifact as
"optional" within generated Maven POMs.

For example
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the generated Maven POM for junit-jupiter-api now contains
the following dependency entry.

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apiguardian</groupId>
      <artifactId>apiguardian-api</artifactId>
      <version>1.0.0</version>
      <scope>compile</scope>
      <optional>true</optional>
    </dependency>

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Do not silently swallow exceptions in ExpectedExceptionSupport

WARNING: this commit fixes the original bug but introduces a new one!

The cause of the original bug is that
`AbstractTestRuleSupport.handleTestExecutionException()` effectively
swallows any exception if there are no registered instances of the
`ExpectedException` rule.

This commit fixes the original bug by counting the number of _members_
that are discovered by having
`invokeAppropriateMethodOnRuleAnnotatedMembers()` return the number of
members and rethrowing the exception if the number of members is zero.
However
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
this change introduces a new bug since
`ExpectedExceptionSupport.handleTestExecutionException()` invokes
`AbstractTestRuleSupport.handleTestExecutionException()` twice: once
for fields and once for methods. Since the "member count" does not
currently aggregate across both fields and methods
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the counting logic
is fundamentally broken.

To fix the new bug introduced in this commit
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: we will therefore need to\ncount the number of all members registered; otherwise
column7:
we don't know if
the adapter is supposed to rethrow the exception.

Issue: #1069

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Fix test compile warnings

Prior to this commit the build log[1] contained hundreds of warnings
similar to the following sample:

  warning: Cannot find annotation method 'status()' in type 'API':
    class file for org.apiguardian.api.API not found

By adding a test-compile-only dependency to 'apiguardian-api' the
test compiler can now find the 'org.apiguardian.api.API' class file.

The generated pom.xml files are _not_ affected by this change.

Issue: #1065

[1] https://travis-ci.org/junit-team/junit5/jobs/276600041

commitMessage:"Make parent/child relationships more consistent

This commit ensures more consistent parent/child relationships by

 * throwing an exception when an AbstractTestDescriptor is already
   linked to a parent and a new parent is passed in to `setParent()`.

 * calling `setParent(null)` on all children in method
   `removeFromHierarchy()` before clearing the children collection.

because

2. CompleteRequests never have filters but filteredRequests always

   all different.

   different.

resolve Unique IDs that clearly belong to other test engines. This is
because JavaElementsResolver.resolveUniqueId(UniqueId) ignored the
Engine ID and then blindly attempted to resolve the supplied Unique ID.
Consequently
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the JupiterTestEngine always logged a warning about not
being able to resolve a Unique ID that it was never meant to resolve.

This commit addresses this issue by ignoring Unique IDs selected via one
of the DiscoverySelectors.selectUniqueId() methods if the Unique ID
belongs to a different test engine.

commitMessage:"Delete dead code.

handleInternalError should only be called when the class cannot be
loaded because of a malformed class name. This means that the error is
thrown by the loadClass.apply call. Therefore the Class object is never
available when handleInternalError is called.
"

commitMessage:"Catch InternalError only for specific code

The InternalError is normally handled like any other Throwable except
when its cause is a malformed class name. The only statement that may
throw such an error is the statement that loads the class. Therefore
the exceptions/errors thrown by other statements can be handled by
generic catch block for Throwables without changing the behaviour of
the method.
"

just to determine if there was a single such
method.

method in ReflectionUtils that searches for a method based on a
supplied predicate and returns true as soon as such a method is found.

commitMessage:"Treat default methods like locally declared methods\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
a non-overridden interface default method would
incorrectly be considered overridden by a locally declared method that
overloads the signature for the default method.

This commit addresses this issue by treating default methods as if they
were locally declared methods.

In addition
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
this commit improves the documentation for
ReflectionSupport and overhauls the internals of ReflectionUtils in the
following ways.

- removal of dead code
- removal of superfluous precondition checks
- consistent error messages for violated preconditions
- enforcement of immutable return types where applicable
- improved diagnostics for failed parameter type resolution
- stable sorting of methods declared in interfaces

Issue: #976

commitMessage:"Fix Javadoc references\n\:
commitMessage:"Simplify search algorithm in ReflectionUtils.findMethod()

This commit modifies the search algorithm by reducing the search to a
single iterative pass matching based on "compatible" signatures which
already includes a preemptive check for exact matches anyway.

Issues: #734
commitMessage:"Improve search algorithm in ReflectionUtils.findMethod()\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
it was impossible to select a method by "fully
qualified method name" (FQMN) if the method was a generic default
method from an interface implemented by a parameterized test class. It
was also impossible to select such a method by class
column7: even though such methods would have been\nexecuted when executing the entire test class
column8: such a method could not\nbe executed alone (e.g.
column9:
in an IDE).

This commit addresses this issue by completely rewriting the
implementation of findMethod() in ReflectionUtils. The algorithm is now
iterative instead of recursive and stops searching once the first match
is found. Furthermore
column10:
the algorithm actually makes two passes:

- first pass: searches for a method whose signature matches exactly.

- second pass: searches for a method whose signature is "compatible"
  with regard to sub-signatures and generics.

The second pass is intended to find interface default methods that
would otherwise not have been considered in the previous implementation
of the search algorithm.

As a positive side effect
column11:
this commit also improves the performance of
look-ups for single methods within a test class hierarchy due to the
new find-first search algorithm.

Issues: #734

commitMessage:"Introduce and enforce syntax for tags\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": tags were trimmed (#942) but were otherwise\nallowed to contain any type of character
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: including whitespace or ISO\ncontrol characters. However
mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
this degree of flexibility can lead to
subtle configuration errors and also makes it challenging to reason
about a tag expression language as proposed in #927.

This commit addresses these issues by introducing and enforcing a
syntax for tags. Specifically
column7:
all tags must now conform to the
following syntax rules.

* A tag must not be null or blank.
* A trimmed tag must not contain whitespace.
* A trimmed tag must not contain ISO control characters.

Consequently
column8:
the following changes make it impossible to create a
TestTag or TagFilter based on a tag that is not syntactically valid.

* The TagFilter.includeTags()
column10:
and
  TestTag.create() factory methods now throw a
  PreconditionViolationException if a supplied tag is not syntactically
  valid.
* @Tag declarations containing invalid tag syntax will now be logged
  as a warning but effectively ignored.

Furthermore
column11:
a new TestTag.isValid(String) method has been introduced
for checking if a tag is syntactically valid. This allows test engines
to preemptively validate the syntax of a tag provided by a user before
attempting to register such an invalid tag.

Issue: #956
"

commitMessage:"Execute test methods in a stable order

Prior to this commit the execution order of reflected test methods was
not well-defined. With this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
the execution order is stabilized
by using same default order as JUnit 4 applies.

Note copied from org/junit/internal/MethodSorter.java

  Using the JVM order is unwise since the Java platform does not
  specify any particular order
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595: and in fact JDK 7 returns a more or less\n  random order; well-written test code would not assume any order
column7: and a predictable failure is better than a random failure\n  on certain platforms. By default
column8:
uses an unspecified but
  deterministic order.

Closes #934
"

commitMessage:"Rename method to getFilterByType.

Provide a consistent API. The method for retrieving selectors already
has the name `getSelectorsByType` instead of
`getDiscoverySelectorsByType`. I think it is helpful to omit the word
discovery in the method name because it reduces its length but the
reader still can deduce from the context (it's an
`EngineDiscoveryRequest`) that the methods return `DiscoveryFilter`s and
`DiscoverySelector`s.
"

commitMessage:"Provide request to DiscoverySelectorResolver.

Each DiscoverySelectorResolver is now responsible for discovering test
classes based on the provided EngineDiscoveryRequest. This minimizes the
interface of DiscoverySelectorResolvers and makes it easier to use them.
"
commitMessage:"Add info the parameters must not be null.\n"

commitMessage:"Don't check that the discovery request is not null.

Engines are called by a launcher. The DefaultLauncher never calls an
engine with a null request. We trust all callers of the `discover`
method to use the engine properly. Hence there is no need to check for
null. (This change was proposed by @marcphilipp in #918.)
"

commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":

lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:

commitMessage:"Add DynamicContainer support

Prior to this commit only a flat collection of dynamically generated
tests was allowed as the return type of a @TestFactory annotated
method. The collection entry type was set to `DynamicTest`.

This commit introduces the abstract base class `DynamicNode` and a
`DynamicContainer` class collecting node instance. @TestFactory
annotated methods are now allowed to return a collection of nodes --
which can be a test or a named container of tests.
Creating a dynamic tree of tests like that gives users the ability to
better structure the generated tests.

The old behaviour

commitMessage:"Rename extension API methods to ensure composability

A concrete extension must be able to implement all extension APIs
supported by JUnit Jupiter without any naming conflicts or ambiguities
with regard to method names or method signatures.

Prior to this commit
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
there existed a number of methods whose
names and method signatures were ambiguous when combined in a single
concrete extension.

This commit addresses this issue by renaming the affected methods.

the tests executed and a result object holding
execution information for own examination.

The new method is marked as `@API(Internal)` for now. The Launcher API
is the promoted and maintained way to start the JUnit Platform:

http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#launcher-api

Addresses #763

commitMessage:"Introduce KitchenSinkExtension

This commit introduces a KitchenSinkExtension that implements every
single extension API in JUnit Jupiter (including junit-jupiter-params)
in order to ensure that a concrete extension is able to implement all
extension APIs supported by JUnit Jupiter without any naming conflicts
or ambiguities with regard to method names or method signatures.

commitMessage:"Optimize Travis build configuration

commitMessage:"Ensure generated diagrams are included in User Guide PDF\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
diagrams created using asciidoctor-diagram were
included in the HTML version of the User Guide but not in the PDF
version. This is due to a limitation within the Asciidoctor ecosystem.
Namely
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the PDF backend for Asciidoctor does not know about the fact
that asciidoctor-diagram has generated images in a target directory.

This commit addresses this shortcoming by introducing the following
work-around inspired by a tip from @mojavelinux.

- We treat the target directory where asciidoctor-diagram generates
  files as an image catalog for both static images and generated
  images.
- We create a custom Copy task that copies all static images to the
  catalog directory.
- The asciidoctor task is configured to depend on the new copy task.
- The imagesdir' and imagesoutdir' attributes of the asciidoctor task
  are both configured to point to the catalog directory.

Issue: #770
"

commitMessage:"Gradle plugin improvements (#751)

* Update to latest Gradle build scan plugin and change Travis CI option to first class `--scan` option
* Upgrade to Checkstyle 7.6
* Introduce Gradle functional tests for validating `'java'` and `'java-library'` plugins work
- Generate classpath manifest for the testkit test compile classpath.
  This is useful so that the locally built versions of the other projects are used during functional testing.
- Test against both the `'java'` and `'java-library'` plugins
* Add functional test for validating `UP-TO-DATE` behavior when test is executed multiple times with no changes
* Make Spock tests more standardized by using `given`
* Switch task creation to use `TaskContainer` and repetitive configuration
* Create `junitPlatformTest` task during configuration phase
See related Gradle issue for making lazy properties at https://github.com/gradle/gradle/issues/726

Closes #708
"

mergeBranchCommitId:null}: and @ParameterizedTest\nare never permitted to be blank. Furthermore

of each of these annotations has been updated to log a warning if a
blank display name (or display name pattern) has been supplied by the
user.

commitMessage:"Introduce support for repeated tests

This commit introduces support for repeating a test a specified number
of times via a new @RepeatedTest annotation.

@RepeatedTest is a @TestTemplate that is supported by a new
RepeatedTestExtension which is automatically registered by default
within the JUnit Jupiter test engine.

In addition to specifying the number of repetitions
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": a custom display\nname can be configured for each repetition via @RepeatedTest.\nFurthermore
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
the display name can be a pattern composed of static text
and dynamic placeholders. The following placeholders are currently
supported.

 - {displayName}: display name of the @RepeatedTest method

 - {currentRepetition}: the current repetition count

 - {totalRepetitions}: the total number of repetitions

The default display name for a given repetition is generated based on
the following pattern: : "{displayName} :: repetition
{currentRepetition} of {totalRepetitions}"

In order to retrieve information about the current repetition and the
total number of repetitions programmatically
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: a developer can choose to\nhave an instance of RepetitionInfo injected into a @RepeatedTest

commitMessage:"Demonstrate that @DisplayName can currently be empty\n\nThis commit introduces a test with an empty
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
custom display name which
should not be permitted.

Issue: #743
"

commitMessage:"Redesign isTest() and isContainer() in TestDescriptor\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": there were ambiguities between the isTest() and\r\nisContainer() methods in TestDescriptor. Due to the fact that each was\r\ntypically backed by a boolean value
lastCommitId:"fd6b40ba08aff580bd450ab595:
there were four possible
combinations of those values which didn't fully represent the goal of
the feature.

This commit addresses these ambiguities by introducing a new
TestDescriptor.Type enumeration with the following constants: ENGINE
column8: CONTAINER_AND_TEST. Any given descriptor can now only\r\nbe assigned one of the enumerated constants
column9:
and the logic for
TestDescriptor.isTest() and TestDescriptor.isContainer() is now based
solely on the descriptor type.

Furthermore
column10:
this commit introduces TestDescriptor.prune() and
TestDescriptor.pruneTree() which allow TestEngine authors to customize
what happens when TestPlan pruning is triggered by the JUnit Platform.

Issue: #508
PR: #720

commitMessage:"Only throw JUnitExceptions from AnnotationUtils\n\nPrior to this commit
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
AnnotationUtils broke a core principle of JUnit
by throwing an AssertionError instead of a JUnitException.

Even though the code block in question should technically never throw
an exception  since it would mean the Java compilers support for
repeatable annotations was broken  this commit nonetheless changes the
code to thrown a JUnitException if such a situation occurs.

mergeBranchCommitId:null}:
etc. were part of the junit-platform-runner module. This
unnecessarily tied these annotations to JUnit 4 even though these
annotations can theoretically be used by any engine or tool wishing to
allow users to configure test suites declaratively.

This commit addresses this issue by moving all such 'suite' annotations
from the `org.junit.platform.runner` package to the
`org.junit.platform.suite.api` package in a new
`junit-platform-suite-api` module.

commitMessage:"Use bottom-up semantics in ReflectionUtils.findMethod()\n\nFor clarity of purpose
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10":
this commit alters the implementation of the
findMethod() variants in ReflectionUtils so that a bottom-up search
algorithm is used with regard to results returned by the search.

Note
mergeBranchCommitId:null}: that the current algorithm actually traverses the entire\ntype hierarchy even after having found a matching method. Thus
column7:
the
switch from top-down to bottom-up does not have any real effect on the
efficiency of the search algorithm when searching for a single method.

commitMessage:"Fix regression for test class hierarchies without bridge methods

Code introduced by [1] broke standard support for test class hierarchies
without bridge or synthetic methods present.
This commit fixes the regression by inspecting the return and parameter
types of the upper method for usage of generic-related types.

[1] https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/commit/82174c15aba026a52a2566ee8643af89917fc1a1
"

commitMessage:"Revamp tree printing listener implementations

The TreePrintingListener now buffers all events in order to emit status
results of containers and render nicer tree branches that indicate the
last test of a container with a closing tile:

	  engine alpha 
	    container BEGIN 
	       test 00 
	       test 01 
	  engine omega 
	     container END 
	       test 10 
	       test 11  aborted
	     container FINAL 
	        skipped  because
	        failing  BMM

The VerboseTreePrintingListener output is not affected by this change
commitDate:"2025-07-03 01:07:10": \nit also retains its immediate printing behavior.\n"

commitMessage:"Vintage stores multiple failures using MultipleFailuresError

Change ota4jVersion to 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT because fix
ota4j-team/opentest4j#34 is required for this to build succesfully.

Fix Vintage engine only storing and reporting only one in case of many
failures as is the case when using JUnit4 ErrorCollector rule.

Use the new Immutable implementation of MultipleFailuresError to report
the multiple failures.

Also fix AssertAll to use the new immutable MFE.

Resolves: #659
See also: ota4j-team/opentest4j#30
